New Records: Georgia's Georges Mikautadze scored three goals, making him the only player with that many at the tournament.
Mikautadze scored in all of Georgia's group-stage games, joining an exclusive list of players who have done that.
Cristiano Ronaldo did not score in Portugal's group-stage matches, marking the first time in his career he failed to score in a major tournament group stage.
Georgia secured their first major tournament victory, beating Portugal 2-0.
Key Match Events: Georgia scored an early goal by Khvicha Kvaratskhelia after just 93 seconds.
Georges Mikautadze converted a penalty to extend Georgia's lead.
Georgia had the lowest possession (28%) but still won the match.
Portugal failed to score despite having more expected goals (2.04).
Post-Match Reflections: Georgia's manager praised the team's performance and resilience.
Portugal's failure to score was a key factor in their loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Georgia's win was the biggest upset in European Championship history on world rankings.
Georgia will face Spain in the last 16, with Spain being a strong favorite.
